definition: point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
to express an opinion/to offer advice
(coll.) to have a stroke of bad luck

sentences.english: The best ideas have to win, otherwise you don’t have good people who stay.
sentences.chinese: 最棒的點子總會勝出，除非你身邊的都是些庸才。

sentences.english: Computers let you try out different styles and ideas.
sentences.chinese: 電腦能讓你嘗試不同的風格和點子。

sentences.english: Rachel has some great ideas for packing and organizing kids stuff for a trip.
sentences.chinese: 雷切爾在關於給孩子旅行裝包方面有着很偉大的點子。

sentences.english: You can’t have good ideas unless you’re willing to generate a lot of bad ones.
sentences.chinese: 除非摒棄諸多不良想法纔會有好點子。

sentences.english: I often wake up with a new idea.
sentences.chinese: 一覺醒來就會想到一個新點子。

sentences.english: Sometimes the best ideas come to us when we're not focused on finding the best ideas.
sentences.chinese: 有時候一些金點子都是在我們不經意間突發靈感的。

sentences.english: We can talk about you idea later, but now lets get back to our muttons .
sentences.chinese: 我們以後再談你的點子，現在咱們言歸正傳。

sentences.english: This kind of examination can produce dozens of new ideas.
sentences.chinese: 這類檢查可以產生數以十計的新點子。

sentences.english: Where there is a demand for innovative ideas Barski Design develops new perspectives for its clients.
sentences.chinese: 巴斯克設計還爲客戶提供創新的設計點子。

sentences.english: Export positions in pips as a spreadsheet.
sentences.chinese: 出口職位點子作爲一個電子表格。

sentences.english: You sit down the night before and you had a couple of ideas.
sentences.chinese: 交論文前一晚終於坐下來，有幾個點子。

sentences.english: Often architects use smaller commissions as testing grounds for new ideas.
sentences.chinese: 通常建築師會將較小的項目作爲新點子的試驗田。

sentences.english: The stone respects once smoke hike, two princesses urgently ask her to have what specter idea.
sentences.chinese: 石敬雲一走，兩公主就急問她有什麼鬼點子了。

sentences.english: I felt golden ideas pouring from the dark blue sky.
sentences.chinese: 我感受到金光閃閃的點子從深藍色的夜幕傾瀉而下。

sentences.english: Let's brainstorm and see if we can come up with some new ideas.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們腦力激盪一下看看能不能有新點子。

definition: to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge
to begin/to initiate/to inaugurate/to start/to create
to have an easy time/(feel) well
to estimate/to reckon/CL:個|个[ge4]/(coll.) to suppose
to adjust downwards/to lower (prices, wages etc)
to demote/to pass down to a lower unit
to compare/to dispute/compared to/(before adj.) relatively/comparatively/rather/also pr. [jiao3]
to touch (physically, one's feelings etc)/to touch on (a topic)
